events.event_description: Cash from operations for 36 U.S. oil E&P companies decreased by 12% to $23.3 billion in Q1 2024 compared to Q1 2023, primarily due to lower natural gas prices.
events.citation: In the first quarter of 2024, lower crude oil and natural gas prices helped reduce cash from operations by 12% compared with the first quarter of 2023, to $23.3 billion.

events.event_description: Natural gas prices dropped 26% year-over-year in Q1 2024, reaching their lowest average monthly inflation-adjusted price since 1997.
events.citation: Natural gas prices fell 26% from the first quarter of 2023 to the first quarter of 2024 and reached their lowest average monthly inflation-adjusted price since at least 1997.

events.event_description: U.S. crude oil production by the analyzed companies increased 5% to 4.2 million barrels per day, despite a 2% decline in West Texas Intermediate crude oil prices.
events.citation: Although West Texas Intermediate crude oil prices declined 2% over this period, U.S. crude oil production by these companies increased 5% to nearly 4.2 million barrels per day (b/d).

events.event_description: Production expenses decreased 40% between Q2 2022 and Q2 2023, with improvements in supply chain, drilling productivity, and Permian region takeaway capacity.
events.citation: Production expenses have since declined, decreasing 40% between the second quarter of 2023 and the recent high in the second quarter of 2022. In addition to supply chain improvements, improved drilling productivity and increasing takeaway capacity in the Permian region have also reduced production expenses on a BOE basis.
